AL.name: Alabama
AL.description: Alabama, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its rich history, beautiful landscapes, and a strong college football culture.

AK.name: Alaska
AK.description: Alaska is the largest U.S. state by area, known for its stunning wilderness, diverse wildlife, and extreme weather conditions.

AZ.name: Arizona
AZ.description: Arizona is known for its desert landscapes, Native American heritage, the iconic Grand Canyon, and vibrant cities like Phoenix and Tucson.

AR.name: Arkansas
AR.description: Arkansas, located in the southern U.S., is known for its diverse natural beauty, including rivers, hot springs, forests, and the Ozark Mountains.

CA.name: California
CA.description: California, the most populous U.S. state, is known for its diverse geography, technology industry, Hollywood, and beautiful coastlines.

CO.name: Colorado
CO.description: Colorado is renowned for its stunning Rocky Mountains, outdoor recreation opportunities, and vibrant cities like Denver and Boulder.

CT.name: Connecticut
CT.description: Connecticut, part of the northeastern U.S., is known for its charming small towns, historic sites, and prestigious universities like Yale.

DE.name: Delaware
DE.description: Delaware, the second smallest U.S. state, is known for its beautiful beaches, historical landmarks, and a favorable business climate.

FL.name: Florida
FL.description: Florida, the Sunshine State, is famous for its warm weather, beautiful beaches, theme parks, and diverse wildlife like alligators and manatees.

GA.name: Georgia
GA.description: Georgia, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its rich history,peach production, and bustling cities like Atlanta, Savannah, and Athens.

HI.name: Hawaii
HI.description: Hawaii, a U.S. state composed of volcanic islands, is known for its tropical climate, breathtaking landscapes, diverse culture, and surfing.

ID.name: Idaho
ID.description: Idaho is famous for its picturesque landscapes, including mountains, forests, and rivers, as well as its rich agriculture and outdoor recreation.

IL.name: Illinois
IL.description: Illinois, a midwestern state, is known for its diverse economy, rich history, and major city, Chicago, which is a global hub for commerce and culture.

IN.name: Indiana
IN.description: Indiana, a midwestern state, is known for its manufacturing industry, agriculture, and sports events like the Indianapolis 500 car race.

IA.name: Iowa
IA.description: Iowa, situated in the Midwest, is known for its fertile farmland, rolling hills, and important role in the U.S. presidential election process.

KS.name: Kansas
KS.description: Kansas, located in the Great Plains, is known for its agriculture, flat landscapes, and significant contributions to U.S. history, including the fight against slavery.

KY.name: Kentucky
KY.description: Kentucky, known for its bluegrass landscapes, is famous for horse racing, bourbon distilleries, and the birthplace of bluegrass music.

LA.name: Louisiana
LA.description: Louisiana, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its rich cultural heritage, unique cuisine, and vibrant music scene, especially in New Orleans.

ME.name: Maine
ME.description: Maine, the northeasternmost U.S. state, is known for its rugged coastlines, quaint fishing villages, lighthouses, and delicious seafood like lobster.

MD.name: Maryland
MD.description: Maryland, a Mid-Atlantic state, is known for its diverse terrain, rich history, and the major city of Baltimore, which is a major cultural and economic center.

MA.name: Massachusetts
MA.description: Massachusetts, located in the northeastern U.S., is known for its rich history, top-tier universities like Harvard and MIT, and vibrant cities like Boston.

MI.name: Michigan
MI.description: Michigan, located in the Great Lakes region, is known for its automotive industry, beautiful lakes and beaches, and the major city of Detroit.

MN.name: Minnesota
MN.description: Minnesota, known as the 'Land of 10,000 Lakes,' is famous for its picturesque landscapes, outdoor recreation, and the vibrant city of Minneapolis.

MS.name: Mississippi
MS.description: Mississippi, located in the Deep South, is known for its rich history, civil rights landmarks, and the birthplace of the blues music genre.

MO.name: Missouri
MO.description: Missouri, situated in the Midwest, is known for its diverse geography, rivers, and major cities like St. Louis and Kansas City.

MT.name: Montana
MT.description: Montana, known as 'Big Sky Country,' is famous for its stunning landscapes, national parks like Glacier and Yellowstone, and outdoor recreation.

NE.name: Nebraska
NE.description: Nebraska, located in the Great Plains, is known for its agriculture, prairies, and significant contributions to American history, such as the Oregon Trail.

NV.name: Nevada
NV.description: Nevada, a western U.S. state, is famous for its desert landscapes, 24-hour entertainment in cities like Las Vegas, and the striking beauty of Lake Tahoe.

NH.name: New Hampshire
NH.description: New Hampshire, located in the northeastern U.S., is known for its picturesque landscapes, quaint towns, and a strong sense of political independence.

NJ.name: New Jersey
NJ.description: New Jersey, situated in the Mid-Atlantic region, is known for its diverse population, Atlantic City, and close proximity to major cities like New York City and Philadelphia.

NM.name: New Mexico
NM.description: New Mexico, located in the southwestern U.S., is known for its vibrant arts scene, Native American culture, and stunning desert landscapes, including White Sands National Park.

NY.name: New York
NY.description: New York, located in the northeastern U.S., is known for its bustling metropolis of New York City, rich history, and natural beauty, including Niagara Falls.

NC.name: North Carolina
NC.description: North Carolina, situated in the southeastern U.S., is known for its diverse geography, ranging from the Appalachian Mountains to the Atlantic coast, and its Research Triangle Park.

ND.name: North Dakota
ND.description: North Dakota, located in the Great Plains, is known for its agriculture, rich history, and stunning natural attractions, such as Theodore Roosevelt National Park.

OH.name: Ohio
OH.description: Ohio, a midwestern state, is known for its industrial history, sports teams, and major cities like Cleveland, Cincinnati, and Columbus.

OK.name: Oklahoma
OK.description: Oklahoma, located in the south-central U.S., is known for its Native American heritage, diverse landscapes, and the historic Route 66.

OR.name: Oregon
OR.description: Oregon, situated in the Pacific Northwest, is known for its stunning coastlines, lush forests, and vibrant cities like Portland.

PA.name: Pennsylvania
PA.description: Pennsylvania, located in the northeastern U.S., is known for its rich history, including sites like Independence Hall, and major cities like Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

RI.name: Rhode Island
RI.description: Rhode Island, the smallest U.S. state, is known for its beautiful coastline, historic sites, and the city of Providence, which is home to the prestigious Brown University.

SC.name: South Carolina
SC.description: South Carolina, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its charming cities, such as Charleston, and its beautiful beaches, including Myrtle Beach and Hilton Head Island.

SD.name: South Dakota
SD.description: South Dakota, situated in the Great Plains, is known for its picturesque landscapes, including the Badlands and Black Hills, and the iconic Mount Rushmore National Memorial.

TN.name: Tennessee
TN.description: Tennessee, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its rich musical heritage, including country, blues, and rock 'n' roll, as well as major cities like Nashville and Memphis.

TX.name: Texas
TX.description: Texas, the second-largest U.S. state, is known for its diverse landscapes, rich history, and major cities like Austin, Houston, and San Antonio.

UT.name: Utah
UT.description: Utah, located in the western U.S., is known for its stunning red rock formations, national parks like Zion and Arches, and the city of Salt Lake City.

VT.name: Vermont
VT.description: Vermont, situated in the northeastern U.S., is known for its picturesque landscapes, maple syrup production, and the city of Burlington.

VA.name: Virginia
VA.description: Virginia, located in the southeastern U.S., is known for its rich history, including early colonial settlements and important Civil War sites, as well as its picturesque landscapes.

WA.name: Washington
WA.description: Washington, situated in the Pacific Northwest, is known for its lush forests, stunning coastlines, and the vibrant city of Seattle, which is a hub for technology and culture.

WV.name: West Virginia
WV.description: West Virginia, located in the Appalachian region, is known for its stunning mountain landscapes, outdoor recreation, and rich history in coal mining and logging.

WI.name: Wisconsin
WI.description: Wisconsin, a midwestern state, is known for its picturesque landscapes, including forests and lakes, as well as its cheese production and major cities like Milwaukee and Madison.

WY.name: Wyoming
WY.description: Wyoming, located in the western U.S., is known for its stunning landscapes, including the Grand Tetons and Yellowstone National Park, as well as its wide-open spaces and outdoor recreation opportunities.

GU.name: Guam
GU.description: Guam, a U.S. territory in the Pacific, offers beautiful beaches, rich Chamorro culture, and a mix of Spanish, American, and Asian influences.

MP.name: Northern Mariana Islands
MP.description: The Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. territory in the Pacific, are known for their pristine beaches, lush landscapes, and unique blend of cultures.

PR.name: Puerto Rico
PR.description: Puerto Rico, a U.S. territory in the Caribbean, boasts beautiful beaches, a vibrant culture, and historic sites such as Old San Juan.

VI.name: Virgin Islands
VI.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands, a Caribbean territory, offer stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and a rich cultural heritage influenced by various nations.
